Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Feierberg, M. A., Evidence for a compositional relationship between asteroids and meteorites from infrared spectral reflectances, Ph.D. thesis, Department of Planetary Sciences, University of Arizona, 1981.

Feierberg, M. A., H. P. Larson, U. Fink, and H. A. Smith, Spectroscopic evidence for two achodrite parent bodies: Asteroids 349 Dembowska and 4 Vesta, Geochimica et Cosmochimica Acta 44, 513-524, 1980.
Feierberg, M. A., L. A. Lebofsky and H. P. Larson, Spectroscopic evidence for aqueous alteration products on the surfaces of low-albedo asteroids, Geochimica et Cosmochimica Acta 45, 971-981, 1981.
Feierberg, M. A., H. P. Larson and C. R. Chapman, Spectroscopic evidence for undifferentiated S-type asteroids, Ap. J. 257, 361-372, 1982.
Larson, H.P. and U. Fink, Infrared Fourier spectrometer for laboratory use and for astronomical studies from aircraft and ground- based telescopes, Appl. Opt. 14, 2085-2095, 1975.
Larson, H. P. and U. Fink, Infrared spectral observations of asteroid 4 Vesta, Icarus 26, 420-427, 1975.
Larson, H. P. and U. Fink, The application of Fourier transform spectroscopy to the remote identification of solids in the solar system, Appl. Spectrosc. 31, 386-402, 1977.
Larson, H. P. and G. J. Veeder, Infrared spectral reflectances of asteroid surfaces. In 'Asteroids' (T. Gehrels, Ed.) pp. 724-744, University of Arizona Press, Tucson, Arizona, 1979.
Larson, H. P., U. Fink, R. R. Treffers, and T. N. Gautier III, The infrared spectrum of asteroid 433 Eros, Icarus 28, 95-103, 1976.
Larson, H. P., M. A. Feierberg, U. Fink, and H. A. Smith, Remote spectroscopic identification of carbonaceous chondrite mineralogies: Applications to Ceres and Pallas, Icarus 39, 257-271, 1979.
Larson, H. P., M. A. Feierberg and L. A. Lebofsky, The composition of asteroid 2 pallas and its relation to primitive meteorites, Icarus 56, 398-408, 1983.

Lebofsky, L. A., M. A. Feierberg, A. T. Tokunaga, H. P. Larson, and J. R. Johnson, The 1.7 to 4.2 micron spectrum of asteroid 1 Ceres: Evidence for structural water in clay minerals. Icarus 48, 453-459, 1981.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: This data set contains 107 asteroid spectra obtained between the years 1975
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set contains 107 asteroid spectra obtained between the years 1975 and 1982 inclusive, with the infrared fourier transform spectrometer (FTS) of H. P. Larson. These spectra were taken by various observers and at various telescopes and were collected onto a project archive tape by M. A. Feierberg and stored by Dr. Larson until they were released to PDS in 1996. Most of these data have been published and the relevent publications are listed in the index file.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview =================
This data set contains 107 asteroid spectra obtained between the years 1975 and 1982 inclusive, with the infrared fourier transform spectrometer (FTS) of H. P. Larson. These spectra were taken by various observers and at various telescopes and were collected onto a project archive tape by M. A. Feierberg and stored by Dr. Larson until they were released to PDS in 1996. Most of these data have been published and the relevent publications are listed in the index file.
Only very limited documentation of these data survive (e. g. the telescope logs have not been preserved) and the information given in the index file are extracted from the header lines of the archive tape and from the published papers.
Parameters ==========
The spectrum files include wavelength in microns and unscaled reflectance in arbitrary units.
Data ====
This data set is inhomogeneous, containing spectra of various levels of processing. Most have some information as to their processing state in the header record, which is reproduced in the index file. Those labeled as 'average spectrum are produced by averaging the data on
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note:
Confidence Level Overview =========================
These spectra are included in the PDS asteroids archive because of their potential usefulness, and in spite of their age and relative lack of documentation. The information about each spectrum given in the index file are taken from the header records of the project archive tape and may include errors. Where possible, the header information is supplemented and corrected with information from the published papers.
Review ======
This data set is scheduled for external peer review on June 1-2, 2000.
Data Coverage and Quality =========================
The data set includes all asteroid spectra from a single project archive tape written by Michael Feierberg in 1983 and preserved by Hal Larson.
